content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. For <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, is less than or equal to 12"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a roller coaster car has position <math alttext="the point with coordinates x of t, comma, y of t"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with velocity vector <math alttext="open angled bracket, 10 comma, negative, t times the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi t, over 4, close parenthesis, close angled bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are measured in meters and <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in seconds. At time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the car is at position <math alttext="0 comma 18"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) What is the slope of the line tangent to the path of the car at time <math alttext="t equals 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. For <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, is less than or equal to 12"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a roller coaster car has position <math alttext="the point with coordinates x of t, comma, y of t"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with velocity vector <math alttext="open angled bracket, 10 comma, negative, t times the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction pi t, over 4, close parenthesis, close angled bracket"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are measured in meters and <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in seconds. At time <math alttext="t equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the car is at position <math alttext="0 comma 18"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) What is the slope of the line tangent to the path of the car at time <math alttext="t equals 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
(b) What is the speed of the car at time <math alttext="t equals 6"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

(c) During the time interval <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 12"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the maximum value of <math alttext="y of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(d) Write, but do not evaluate, an expression that gives the average speed of the car over the time interval <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 12"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
